text: William Penn Taylor was a nineteenth-century congressman from Virginia. ==Early life== Born in Fredericksburg, Virginia, October 25, 1790Find a grave memorial the son of Congressman John Taylor. William Taylor received a limited schooling as a child.Congressional Biographical Directory, "William Taylor" ==Career== He held several local political offices in Caroline County, Virginia, including as a delegate to the Virginia Constitutional Convention of 1829-1830 where he served alongside Robert B. Taylor from Norfolk, a Brigadier General in the state militia.Pulliam 1901, p. 82 Taylor was elected to the Virginia House of Delegates for the session 1830/31 from Caroline County, Virginia.Swem 1918, p. 436 He was elected an Anti-Jacksonian to the United States House of Representatives in 1832, serving from 1833 to 1835 and being unsuccessful for reelection.Congressional Biographical Directory, "William Taylor" In 1845, Taylor served as a presidential elector.Pulliam 1901, p. 82 ==Death== He died at his estate called "Hayfield" in Caroline County, Virginia June 18, 1863William Penn TaylorWilliam Penn Taylorand was interred in the family cemetery on the estate. ==References== ==Bibliography== * * * Category:Members of the United States House of Representatives from Virginia Category:Politicians from Fredericksburg, Virginia Category:Virginia National Republicans Category:19th-century American politicians Category:National Republican Party members of the United States House of Representatives William P. Category:People from Caroline County, Virginia Category:1791 births Category:1863 deaths
title: William P. Taylor
